The vow breaker. Or, The faire maide of Clifton In Notinghamshire as it hath beene diuers times acted by severall companies with great applause. By William Sampson. Sampson, William, 1590?-1636.
[76] p. : ill. (woodcut)
Printed by Iohn Norton and are to be sold by Roger Ball at the signe of the Golden Anchor in the Strand, neere Temple-Barre, London : 1636.
Mostly in verse. Signatures: A-I⁴ K² . Running title reads: The vow-breaker, or the fayre maid of Clifton. Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
=======
